title.narrative: Endurance tests DrillCutter: HS towards low impact / high efficiency dredging system in the United Arab Emirates

description.narrative: • Short general project overviewThe United Arab Emirates (UAE) faces major challenges in terms of water security and water safety in the urban environment. Large and continuous growth means that living environments need to be expanded and preserved and the water supply and purification must be realised more efficiently. In addition to many innovations and investments required in this context, the (water) infrastructure in the urban delta and coastal waters must be prepared to achieve the water ambitions of the UAE, including through dredging. Although a lot of attention is paid to water and energy savings in the industry, dredging is still carried out through conventional techniques. This sector is extremely polluting because large ships are needed to operate the heavy dredging systems. The systems themselves also have a negative impact underwater because they cause water obfuscation (turbidity) which suffocates benthic organisms and coral. In addition, dredging by large ships has a negative effect on the coastal islands. Among other things for these reasons large ships are exiled off the coast of the UAE. This is an urgent search for innovative dredging systems with a lower impact, but higher efficiency that dredging work can achieve off the coast and in urban delta.• Initial activities and results of the projectWith the DrillCutter technology that DredgeYard has developed, the following advantages are achieved:- Because the extraction channel is placed in/behind the cutting head, the extraction is directly at the source, increasing its effectiveness.- DredgeYard's cutting head can run at a speed of 90 RPM instead of the average 30 RPM, which again improves the efficiency of the system with Factor 9.- Water clouding (turbidity) decreases by 90%, due to a closed system that leaves almost nothing behind, thus minimal impact on the soil.This feasibility study is being carried out in preparation for a large-scale pilot phase in which Dredgeyard's innovative dredging technology can be demonstrated in an operational environment. Before this can be done, research must be carried out into the long-term technical working principle (by means of endurance tests). The tests can also quantify the technical, economic and environmental advantages of the DrillCutter compared to current dredging technologies. This information is necessary to convince an end user to carry out a pilot project.The feasibility study covers the following activities:- Research: Technical data from the end user must be collected. Further research is required in local laws and regulations that affect the development of the prototype.- Development: Further development of the prototype in addition to the technical data collected from the end user.- Testing: in operational environment in the UAE for a duration of four weeks.- Collecting and analysing data: energy / environment / operational costs / efficiency (speed and mass).
